message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.DB, cs.SI, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses a similarity measure for scientific literature databases, which involves finding a set of papers similar to the paper under consideration. This is a common task in information retrieval (IR) and digital libraries (DL), which are subfields of computer science (CS). The paper also mentions using a database with real-world papers from DBLP, which is a digital library for computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval), followed by cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.DB (Databases), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
